intro: Trichilia tocacheana, commonly known as the Tocachean tallow tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes species known for their valuable timber and medicinal properties. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, featuring a straight trunk and dense, glossy green leaves. Its flowers are small and fragrant, typically appearing in clusters, and it produces woody fruits containing smooth, oval seeds. The bark and leaves of Trichilia tocacheana have been used in traditional medicine for their potential anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
